The best bank switching, cashback, interest & overdraft offer (August 2023)

Your ultimate list of promotions, rewards and benefits you can get from switching your current account or opening another.

One of the quickest ways to make some extra cash is to take advantage of the very competitive current account market and get a switching bonus, cashback or high interest on your savings.

There are always a number of these and it can be hard to know which is the best for you. In this article I’ve broken down the offers at each major UK bank.

Quick Links

Here are some quick links to help you jump through to more information on the deals, or keep scrolling to see more about each bank.

Switching bonus deals

You must switch and close your old account to get the headline bonuses listed below.

  • Barclays Premier – “£167.50” Avios switch bonus
  • Co-operative – £125 refer-a-friend switch bonus
  • First Direct – £175 switch bonus + £40 cashback
  • Lloyds – £150 switch bonnus
  • Natwest – £200 switch bonus
  • RBS – £200 switch bonus
  • TSB – Up to £200 switch bonus + up to £40 cashback
  • Ulster Bank – £200 switch bonus

Welcome cash deals

You can get these offers just for opening an account, though they sometimes require a referral link.

  • Monese – Up to £30 for opening an account and spending
  • Monzo – £5 welcome reward
  • Santander – £25 cashback when opening an account
  • Triodos – £60 voucher or charity donation
  • TSB – £20 to £40 cashback for opening an account

High-interest current accounts

  • Barclays – 5.12% interest on £5,000
  • Chase – 3.1% interest
  • First Direct – 7% regular saver
  • Halifax – 5.5% regular saver
  • HSBC – 5% regular saver, 3.5% on up to £10,000
  • Lloyds – 6.25% regular saver
  • Nationwide – 5% interest for one year on £1,500
  • Natwest – 6.17% regular saver
  • Santander Edge – 4% on up to £4,000 (before fee)
  • Santander Edge Up – 3.5% on up to £25,000 (before fee)
  • Virgin Money – 3% ISA, 2.02% on £1,000 / 2.52% on up to £25,000

Cashback accounts

  • Chase – 1% back on purchases for 12 months
  • Santander Edge – 1% cashback on bills & 1% on some spending (before fee)
  • Santander Edge Up – 1% cashback on bills & 1% on some spending (before fee)

Reward offers

  • Halifax – £5 a month “reward” or cinema tickets after fee
  • NatWest –  Up to £3 monthly reward after fee
  • RBS – Up to £3 monthly reward after fee
  • Lloyds – free Disney+, magazine subscription or cinema tickets
  • Co-Op – Earn up to £2.20 a month extra
  • TSB – Up to £5 a month for first six months

Fee-free overseas spending

  • Chase
  • Monzo ( full review )
  • Starling ( full review )
  • Virgin Money

Overdrafts

  • First Direct – £250 interest-free overdraft
  • Lloyds – £50 buffer
  • Nationwide – 12 months interest-free overdraft
  • Monzo – possible 19%, 29% or 39% overdraft
  • Starling – possible 15%, 25% or 35% overdraft

Ethical banks

As rated by Ethical Consumer magazine. Listen to my podcast episode on the topic for more.

  • Triodos
  • Nationwide

** All efforts have gone into ensuring the accuracy of these deals. However, changes do happen so make sure you read the terms and conditions of the account and any switching offer before applying**

Why switching is worth it

If you’ve been with the same bank since your first job or University, you’re probably missing out. Since seven-day switching was introduced in 2013 the banks have been offering free cash, high interest and other extras to get you to move to them.

Just from switching, I made £1,900 between 2013 and 2018 – and a few hundred more since. And there’s more to be made from other benefits just by opening additional bank accounts. Sadly a raft of banks have cut their high-interest rates in current accounts , but that doesn’t mean you won’t be better off moving your bank account.

More than one current account?

Barclays

Barclays doesn’t have a specific reward account. Instead you can add “Blue Rewards” to most Barclays accounts.

Barclays switching offers

Barclays occasionally offers double Blue Rewards for a year as a switching incentive. It last ran this in 2019. Here’s my blog post asking Is the Barclays Blue Reward worth switching for?

However there’s an additional offer for new Barclays Premier customers who switch in. They’ll earn Avios points that can be changed to £167ish worth of Nectar points.

This is only for customers who have large salaries or huge amounts saved with Barclays (it might be possible to get accepted as a joint couple who meet this requirement combined). You also have to be brand new to Barclays too.

You need to add on Barclays Avios Rewards which costs £12 a month, though you’ll earn most of that back in Avios points (1,500 a month = £10 when converted to Nectar). You can’t have both Blue Rewards and Avios Rewards at the same time.

Blue Rewards benefits

Factoring in the fee and assuming you’ll only have the basic two Direct Debits, you won’t get charged for adding Blue Rewards to your Barclays current account. This will then give you access to a 5.12% paying Rainy Day savings account, paid on up to £5,000 saved. Read all the details of Blue Rewards here.

Read my review of Barclays Blue Rewards

Open a Barclays current account

Back to top

Bank of Scotland

The main current accounts at Bank of Scotland are the Classic and Platinum. The latter is a packaged account with added insurance and breakdown cover for a monthly fee of £21.

There’s no set reward account with BoS, but you can get the Vantage add on which offers interest on balances. The Club Lloyds account is similar but has extra freebies.

Bank of Scotland switching bonus

Bank of Scotland isn’t running a switching offer right now.

Bank of Scotland Vantage benefits

The Vantage add on is free but there are conditions to meet in order to get the interest. You’re able to get better interest rates elsewhere.

Open a Bank Of Scotland current account

Back to top

Chase

This new bank from Chase was launched in September 2021. You can read about the features in my analysis here .

Chase Bank welcome bonus (ended)

The new £20 referral scheme began on 11 May 2022 and ended 7 June 2022. You do not need to switch. Here’s more on how it works , and how to refer your friends (earning up to £400).

Sign up for Chase and get £20

Chase Bank benefits

Read more about the Chase UK account

Back to top

Co-operative Bank

Co-operative Bank is regarded as a more ethical bank. The Everyday Rewards bundle can be added to the standard Current Account.

Co-operative Bank switching bonus

Co-operative Bank has started a refer-a-friend switching bonus worth £125 for the new customer and £125 for the existing customer.

There’s no limit to how many people can be referred. You will need the name, account number, sort code and email address of the person referring you to get the bonus – so ask around friends and family if you want to take advantage of the promo. My full analysis is here.

Co-op Bank Everyday Rewards benefits

The is an optional extra you can add to your account but requires more effort than other accounts to get the money. The bulk of the £2.20 a month is dependent on using your debit card, which means you’ll likely get less if you don’t use it 60 times each month.

The monthly reward reduced on 1 July 2021, and the most you’ll get is £2.20 a month.

Open a Co-operative Bank current account

Back to top

First Direct

First Direct always scores well on customer service, but bear in mind there are no branches – banking is all on the phone or online. It’s also part of the HSBC group, so the FSCS protection is shared between the two.

First Direct switching bonus

First Direct currently offers £175 for opening a 1st Account with them and switching in. Here’s my full analysis of the offer.

You can also currently get a £40 bonus if you apply for the account via cashback site Quidco. If you’re not already a Quidco user you can get a welcome bonus of up to £17 when you join .

First Direct has consistently offered some kind of switching bonus, though this was paused for most of 2020 due to the pandemic. The incentive has mainly been cash, though in 2018 First Direct briefly replaced it with a choice of freebies. For a while there was also a “goodbye” offer, giving you the chance to get another £100 if you didn’t like the account.

The lowest the offer has is been £50, and occasionally it increases to £125 and even £150, but expect £100 as the standard rate. A refer-a-friend offer ran until 2019.

First Direct 1st account benefits

First Direct traditionally offered the highest paying regular saver account, but since early 2021 this can be beaten or equalled elsewhere.

The £250 0% buffer is a useful feature for anyone who occasionally goes overdrawn by a small amount.

Open a First Direct 1st current account

Back to top

Halifax

Halifax has a standard and packaged account, but the Halifax Reward option is my pick for a monthly reward of £5 cash, cinema tickets or movie rentals. The bank regularly offers switching incentives.

Halifax switch deal

From 14 March until 3 April 2023 Halifax is offering £175 for switching to a new Halifax Reward or Ultimate Reward account.

The Reward account is my pick of the two and you can earn a £5 monthly reward. The Ultimate Rewards account has added features such as insurance but comes with a £17 monthly fee.

It’s open to existing Halifax customers too, even if you already hold one of these accounts. Here’s more information about how to get the £175.

Halifax has regularly been offering cash bonuses of between £75 and £150 since switching began in 2013. More recently it ran offers in April/May and July/August 2021 (£100) and October/December 2021, March/May 2022 (£125) and July/August 2022 (£150).

Halifax Reward account benefits

If you jump through a few hoops you can easily make £60 a year from this Reward account. There are alternative rewards available that could be worth more – check out my analysis for further details .

In the same article you can see why I prefer the £500 debit card method over the £5,000 savings options.

Read my review of the Halifax Reward account

Open a Halifax current account

Back to top

HSBC

HSBC’s current accounts don’t have many extra benefits with their accounts and score badly in Ethical Consumer’s list of banks.

There are regular switching bonuses, often the highest paying ones in the market.

HSBC and First Direct are linked banks for the purpose of FCSC protection.

HSBC switch offer (ended)

You can get a £200 bonus when switching to the HSBC Advance current account, but that could be increased to as much as £250.

Cashback site Quidco is offering £40 extra when you apply via their site.

You need two Direct Debits or standing orders to qualify for the bonus. Unless you have spare Direct Debits you want to move, I’d go for the latter and simply transfer money from another bank account (and then back again!). Here’s my guide to the offer .

The account requirement of a £1,750 monthly deposit doesn’t need to stay in the account.

HSBC Advance account benefits

This account has higher thresholds than others, and successful applicants must pass a credit check for a £1,000 approved overdraft.

Open an HSBC current account

Lloyds Bank

Club Lloyds is Lloyds Bank’s reward account and often comes with a switching bonus.

Club Lloyds switching bonus

The new switching bonus from Lloyds Bank is worth £150 and runs from 9 May to 17 July 2023. Once the switch has completed you’ll get the payment within 3 working days.

It’s only for Club Lloyds, Club Lloyds Silver and Club Lloyds Platinum accounts and only for new accounts.

Existing Lloyds customers can take advantage though you don’t qualify this time if you’ve received a switching bonus from Lloydsor Halifax since April 2020.

Only one payment will be made per customer, so you can’t get it twice via joint accounts.

All the details on how to do this, and my full analysis of the offer can be found here.

Club Lloyds account benefits

I’m a fan of this reward account as it’s relatively simple to get the freebies. I’ve analysed which “Lifestyle Benefit” is the best value for money in my Club Lloyds review.

The interest on offer is the same as the Bank Of Scotland Advantage account, and this requires two active direct debits. However you can get higher interest rates elsewhere .

Read my review of the Club Lloyds current account

Open a Club Lloyds current account

Back to top

Metro Bank

Metro Bank scores better than the established high street banks in Ethical Consumers’s list of ethical current accounts.

Metro Bank switching offer (ended)

Metro introduced a brand new referral offer in 2020, but that ended 18th December 2020. The offer was £50 for both the person referring and the person signing up and switching. It was capped at £250 for the existing Metro customer. I’ll update it here it returns.

Open a Metro Bank current account

Back to top

Monese

Monese is another challenger bank that is 100% opened and operated via your mobile phone. You don’t need an address to open the account, but you do need photo ID.

There are four levels of Monese, including a free “Starter” tier. There is a £4.95 fee on this level for your debit card.

There are occasional special discounts for account holders on gift cards, eg 20% off Amazon, though these haven’t run in 2023.

Monese account opening offer – Up to £30

**My link seems to have reached its limit however if you find someone who can share their own referral code you’ll be able to take advantage.**

This offer could earn you up to £30 in credit, though you’ll have to pay just under a fiver to get the card.

Sign up with a promo code ( ANDR4552 (code expired) or via this via this link ). You can sign up for any tier, though I’d go for the free plan.

Once you get the card, use it for any transaction to earn £30. There’s no minimum spend required to trigger this bonus.

To get the next bonus, you need to spend another £500 on the card or send the same amount abroad. This can be any number of transactions. Once you reach that level you’ll get another £10 credit added to your account.

IMPORTANT: Payments with your Monese card towards things like credit card bills don’t count, so you will need to “spend” the money.

Download the Monese app

Monzo

Monzo is one of the original digital-only banks. There are three options:

  • Free (full review )
  • Plus ( full review )
  • Premium ( full review )

Personally I’d only go for the basic option.

New users can also get £5 for signing up via refer-a-friend code, which you can get below.

Monzo account opening offer

* 11 June – I think this offer may have been paused. Ask friends if they still have a link you can use that explicitly mentions the £5*

You can get £5 free cash from Monzo when you join for the first time. You’ll need to get a refer-a-friend link from an existing customer, or use the one below. These links can be limited, so make sure the landing page explicitly says you’ll earn £5. If it doesn’t, see if you can find another link. You’ll get the fiver once you’ve done this.

Open a Monzo account

Natwest Bank

Natwest regularly offers a switching bonus and has a Reward account offering money back each month.

Natwest switch offer

A new offer from Natwest started on 14 February 2023, with no published end date. You can get £200 for a switch from another bank into a new or existing account.

As with RBS when it has run it’s been available to existing customers, though you couldn’t get the money from Natwest too.

I’ve written a full analysis of this offer with more details on how it works.

In both 2018 and 2019 Natwest offered switching bonuses on three occasions. The typical offer is £100 but has been as high as £150. It returned in October and November 2020 offering £125. It also ran 24 January 2022, and runs until 7 April 2022 offering £150. A £175 offer ran September to November 2022.

Natwest Reward account benefits

This used to be a much better account, offering cashback on your bills every month. But that changed in early 2020 and now it’s a set payment each month, as long as you meet the criteria.

There’s a £2 monthly fee which you can’t avoid. Once this fee is taken into account you’re looking at a return of £36 a year.

This is paid into a separate MyReward account that you have to cash out to your account or a gift card.

You do however get access to a top paying regular saver .

Read my review of the Natwest Digital Saver account

Open a Natwest Reward current account

Nationwide Building Society

Nationwide is seen as the most ethical of the main high street banks (it’s actually a building society). The FlexDirect account offers interest on balances and a 0% overdraft for first year. The FlexPlus account offers insurance and breakdown cover for a monthly fee of £13.

Nationwide switching offer (ended)

The biggest ever switching offer started October 3 2022, offering £200. Previously it was £100 for new Nationwide customers and £125 for exiting members. The offer ended on 30 November 2022

You can also claim this offer twice. Once for a personal account and once for a joint account (though this latter one is one payment for both parties in the joint account). I’ve written in detail about this switching offer here.

Nationwide used to offer a refer-a-friend promotion where both people got £100 if the new customer switched from another bank. This was paused when the pandemic started in March 2020 and was replaced by the new switching offer in August 2021.

Nationwide FlexDirect account benefits

This account pays the highest in-account interest (on up to £1,500) and has the largest 0% overdraft. You can only get the account benefits in your first 12 months.

However, the app can also be very frustrating to use. More details in my Nationwide FlexDirect review .

Read my review of the Nationwide FlexDirect current account

Open a Nationwide FlexDirect current account

Back to top

RBS (Royal Bank of Scotland)

RBS regularly offers a switching bonus and has a Reward account offering money back each month.

RBS switching offer

RBS launched a £200 switch deal on 14 February 2023.

As with Natwest when it has run it’s been available to existing customers, though you couldn’t get the money from Natwest too.

I’ve written a full analysis of this RBS offer with more details on how it works here.

The previous offers include £150 from 3 February 2022 until 21 April 2022 and £175 in October 2022.

RBS Reward account benefits

This is identical to the Natwest Reward account. You can get a £5 monthly bonus but must pay a £2 fee too. This means the most you’ll make from this account in a year is £36.

This is paid into a separate MyReward account that you have to cash out to your account or a gift card.

You do however get access to the top paying regular saver .

Read my review of the RBS Digital Saver account

Open an RBS Reward current account

Back to top

Revolut

Revolut is a popular digital-only bank with four tiers.

  • Standard – £0 a month
  • Plus – £2.99 a month
  • Premium – £6.99 a month
  • Metal – £12.99 a month

Personally I’d only go for the basic option, though this only comes as standard with a virtual debit card. If you want a physical card you will have to pay for it.

Revolut account opening offer (ended)

You can get a £10 free credit from Revolut when you join for the first time via this link and access to one month’s free Premium.

To get the tenner you need to top up your account from another bank and then spend at least £1 on the card.

You’ll have to pay if you want a physical card so I wouldn’t bother. There’s a virtual card you can use straight away from the app or add to your phone’s wallet.

You don’t have to take the one-month free Premium but if you do it has to be within 72 hours of signing up. If you don’t want to continue with Premium once the initial month you can easily downgrade in the app. Don’t forget or you’ll pay £6.99 a month. If you ordered the card you’ll have to pay for it, so again, don’t do this unless you’re going to stick with Premium.

Full terms and conditions are available when you click through. Ends 31 December 2022.

Open a Revolut account

Santander

There are two key Santander accounts, the Edge Up, which has a £5 fee but also offers interest, and the 123 Edge which is £3 a month. Both provide cashback on your household bills.

Read my review of the Santander Edge Up

Santander cashback offer – £25

If you apply for a Santander Everyday, Edge or Edge Up current account via Quidco or TopCashback there’s a £25 cashback payment. You can join Quidco or TopCashback for a welcome bonus here.

You can now no longer get a 123 or 123 Lite account, though they’ll remain open for existing account holders.

Santander switch offer (finished)

Santander has rarely offered any switching incentives – but in 2021 it launched an offer for new and existing customers.

You need to switch into a 123, Edge, Everyday, Select or Private account. Here’s my full analysis.

Santander Edge benefits

This account replaces the 123 Lite, though it’s not quite the same. My full review is here.

Santander Edge Up benefits

This account replaces the full 123. My full review is here.

Triodos

Triodos is regarded as one of the most ethical current accounts out there – but it does come with a £3 a month fee. Herre’s my full review.

Triodos referral offer

Sign up to Triodos’s current account via a referral link and you can get a £60 voucher to use at Ethical Superstore or Neals Yard. Or you can choose to have the money donated to charity. The existing customer that refers you will have a £25 donation made on their behalf.

You don’t need to switch to get the bonus, but you must pay in £100.

Here’s more on the current deal.

Triodos account benefits

You’ll pay for this account but you’ll have peace of mind in return that your money isn’t used for investing practices and organisations that could conflict with your values.

Read my review of the Triodos current account

Open a Triodos current account

TSB

TSB’s popular Classic Plus accounts stopped paying interest in December 2020 and were replaced for new applicants by the Spend & Save account.

Bizarrely you’re better off with the free version of the account, potentially earning you £30 in the first six months. The premium version could net you double that with £60 – but the £3 monthly fee would leave you with a £24 profit.

TSB switching offer

A new switching deal runs 10 July 2023 worth up to £200. There’s no set end date, but it’ll likely be in August.

It’s also possible to get an extra cashback bonus via cashback sites Quidco and TopCashback, and from the accounts themselves. Read my full analysis here.

TSB cashback offer

If you don’t want to switch you can earn cashback from both Quidco or TopCashback when opening either the Spend & Save account or the Spend & Save Plus account. The amounts are usually £20 to £30 for the former and £40 for the latter.

You don’t need to follow the separate Spend & Save requirements to get the cashback. If you’re new to either cashback site you can also get a welcome bonus , though it won’t track on this offer as both require a minimum spend.

TSB Spend & Save account benefits

I think the effort to use your debit card 20 times a month isn’t worth it and you’re better off using a cashback credit card.

Open a TSB Spend & Save current account

TSB Spend & Save Plus account benefits

The extra features found with this account are available for free elsewhere.

Open a TSB Spend & Save account

Ulster Bank

Ulster Bank sometimes offers a switching bonus.

Ulster switching offer

Ulster launched a £200 switch deal on 14 February 2023.

As with Natwest and RBS when it has run it’s been available to existing customers. Though technically you can’t get the money from Natwest and RBS too, some have been able to.

I’ve written a full analysis of this Ulster Bank offer with more details on how it works here.

Apply for an Ulster current account

Back to top

Virgin Money

Virgin Money has taken over from Yorkshire Bank, Clydesdale Bank and their digital B Bank. Here’s my review of the bank’s main current account.

Virgin Money switching offer (ended)

Virgin Money has offered six different switching offers since December 2020 under the name “Brighter Money Bundle”. The latest is for 25% cashback on supermarket and fuel shopping ( details here ).

Until 31 October 2022 you can also get an extra £30 Amazon voucher if you open the account via the budgeting app Snoop, and there’s a £ 5 Amazon welcome offer when you sign up too

So far it looks like they’re changing the offer every three or four months. Previous offers have included:

  • 15 bottles of wine from Virgin Wine (Dec 20 to Mar 21)
  • 12 bottles and a £50 charity donation (Mar 21 to summer 21)
  • £150 Virgin Experiences voucher
  • £100 Virgin Experience voucher and 3% bonus interest (Jan 22 to April 22)
  • 20,000 Virgin points (April 22 to August 22)

Here’s more on the current deal.

Virgin Money M Plus account benefits

The big draw with this account is the interest you can earn on the first £1,000 saved in the account, and then on the linked account. It’s also fee-free to suse the card overseas.

Read my review of the Virgin Money M Plus current account

  10. Karl May 12, 2022 at 9:46 pm

    Hi Andy, regarding the TSB Spend & Save account, I just wanted to share the method I’m using to get the “£5 per month for 6 months” offer, with very little effort.
    Firstly, open an account at the beginning of the month, as it counts as the first of the 6 months and means you will have plenty of time to use the debit card 30 times.
    Secondly, to make 30 transactions on the debit card each month, I used my Amazon account and topped up my gift card balance with 30 x £1 top-ups, over a few days. It takes about 15 minutes in total but is obviously only useful if you intend to buy something from Amazon, as you will end up with £180 on your gift card balance after 6 months. However, the gift card balance is valid for 10 years, so you don’t need to rush and make unnecessary purchases.
    Finally, transactions take a few days to appear in the TSB account, so ensure all 30 transactions are completed by around the 25th of each month. The £5 is then paid around the 10th of the following month.
    Hope this helps a few of your readers / viewers.

  33. Oluwole November 10, 2019 at 8:51 am

    Does switching adversely affect one’s credit score?

    Reply
    1. Andy Webb November 11, 2019 at 9:26 am

      There will be a credit check when you apply to open most current accounts, so it’s worth a) checking your credit report for any errors before applying, and b) avoiding any credit applications – if you can – if you’re planning on getting a mortgage in the next six months. Also, one thing that credit reports do like is a long relationship with a bank, so potentially moving away from someone you’ve been with for a long time could see your score dip. But you should be ok to go through with a switch absolutley fine.

      Reply
